bioghist.p: Henry Miller (1891-1980) was an American author and painter. He was best known for his controversial novels Tropic of Cancer (1934) and Tropic of Capricorn (1939), which were banned in the United States for obscenity. Meary James Thurairajah Tambimuttu (1915-1983) was a Tamil poet, editor and critic. In 1938, he started Poetry London, a small, but influential magazine that he edited until 1949. He founded several other poetry journals and also published a number of his own writings.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of Miller's letters to M. J. Tambimuttu, written between 1943 and 1952. The letters discuss publication of Miller's writings (articles, books, open letters), sales and exhibitions of his paintings, funding for his life as an artist and writer, and the works of contemporary authors. The collection also includes two watercolors by Miller, clippings of "An Open Letter" from the New Republic, an announcement for a show of his paintings, and a photograph of Miller at Big Sur.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
